At the outset, injecting waste plastics, which have a higher calorific values (CV) than coal, decreases blast furnace coke and energy consumption and lowers CO 2 emissions by about 30% in comparison to coke and coal depending on the type of polymers used as shown in Figure 18 [ 25, 59], according to the Reactions (5) and (6): Fe 2O 3 + 3CO → 2Fe + 3CO 2 (coke, pulverized coal) (5)
Fe 2O 3 + 2CO + H 2 → 2Fe + 2CO 2 +H 2O (using plastic) (6)
